sentence.content: He told the National Governors&apost; Association that he was committed to &apost;ending welfare as we know it&apost; with measures to finance expanded job training for the unemployed, matched by a requirement that people must do some kind of work for their welfare cheque.

sentence.content: The president said he would focus on better implementation of the Family Support Act, a 1988 welfare reform based on the work of an NGA task-force which he, as governor of Arkansas, co-chaired.

sentence.content: Advocates of welfare reform had been discouraged about the new administration&apost;s intentions, fearing that the centrist Democratic emphasis on requiring welfare recipients to work or enroll for training might fall prey to left-wing advocacy groups concentrating on greater funding of existing programmes.

sentence.content: These suspicions were enhanced when Ms Donna Shalala, new secretary of health and human services, last month devoted only one sentence to welfare reform in a five-page statement of goals.
